transcript.title: Regulation of Ports
transcript.content:
The Queensland Premier is wrong to claim, as he did on ABC television today, that I have repudiated the Commonwealth-State agreement regarding the nation's ports.

The Commonwealth has reserved the right all along to legislate for a single regulator if the co-operative approach with the states did not deliver better outcomes. That remains our position.

Following the COAG meeting on 14 July 2006 I said:
